title: Will Kim Jong-un and Moon Jae-in meet before 1 November 2018?
preds: Boom goes the dynamite. Few would have predicted this months ago (kudos to @Prognosticating-beek )
Though North Korea also engages in propaganda broadcasts of its own, it has long objected to the South's use of speakers, and has at times responded to them with artillery fire.

KJU is bending over backward to make this happen. The latest: https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/north-korean-leader-suspends-nuclear-and-missile-tests-shuts-down-test-site/2018/04/20/71ff2eea-44e7-11e8-baaf-8b3c5a3da888_story.html
next week... planned... end of war agreement
its a foregone conclusion now like christine lagarde
Ten days to go....nothing on the horizon looks to impede the meeting from happening.
2 weeks away. If the talks were delayed or called off there's still plenty of time to reschedule before Nov 1.
Allegedly the 27th of April.  See last graph.  http://abcnews.go.com/International/kim-jong-talks-inter-korean-summit-meeting-trump/story?id=54359428

While relations have been tense between these two countries, there are signs of improving diplomatic ties, the first of which being North Korea's participation in the 2018 winter olympics. This allowance made on the part of South Korea indicates a willingness to open diplomatic ties. Building on this, it is far and away in North Koreas best interest to improve ties with South Korea, especially as a means of softening ties with the United States. North Korea has recently been pursuing better diplomatic strategies; South Korea would be an important first step.

A continuation of the current efforts to lower tensions will require high level meetings between Kim Jong-un, Chinese leadership and of course South Korea. Kim will meet with Moon after meeting with the Chinese
Now that Jong-un has been to China I see it as increasingly likely unless the U.S. "interferes"
after Beijing visit by Un and the developing trade tensions with US, expect a Pan Asia initiative that marginalizes the US influence

On March 29, South Korean President Moon Jae-in announced that he will meet North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on April 27, 2018 (http://time.com/5220013/kim-jong-un-and-moon-jae-in-to-meet/). According to TIME, the nations agreed to host a leaders summit. While it is possible that one of the leaders could back out of the meeting over the next few weeks, I argue that this firm commitment from both sides, coupled with the fact that officials from both nations have now met twice to discuss the logistics of the meeting, supports my forecast that it is very likely that the two leaders will meet before 1 November 2018.
The meeting has been set and will occur this month.

If Mr Kim is meeting President Trump, chances are he will meet the South Korean president too. He met the Chinese leader before, so meeting his southern neighbor follows. Only a fortuitous event could derail this, an since rationality was not predominant in that quarter before, it could come back.

There is always the possibility that Kim Jong-Un will do something highly irrational, and given the opaque nature of the the regime it doesn't seem prudent to put the probability at higher than 90%.  History is replete with examples of how the North Korean regime initially makes a move to have sanctions lifted only to turn around within weeks and take some provocative action.
Late update, but a meeting date is set and I can't see there being anything to gain by withdrawing at this point. The US has agreed to meet. Kim even left to visit China. Everyone's meeting with NK.
It was announced that two of them will meet in DMZ on April 27. Both parties are highly incentivized to meet. There is little reason to expect something different with less than a month to go.
April 27th. It's before November 1st on my calendar.

North and South Korea's leaders have agreed to meet one another for just the third time ever on April 27, The Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday. "The one-day inter-Korean summit, the first since 2007," is set to take place "at the inter-Korean truce village of Panmunjom" and "comes as countries have stepped up enforcement of sanctions aimed at penalizing North Korea for its nuclear-weapons program." ( Big D Defense News on line)https://www.wsj.com/articles/north-and-south-korea-set-date-for-summit-1522306351
Factors that went into my *updated* (31 March) forecast:
a date has been set:  April 27th
Pyongyang, Seoul agree to hold inter-Korean summit on April 27. I would go to 100% except that NK leaders have a history of volatility/.
Kim traveled to China. Makes a meeting more likely.
Visiting China ups the odds by +3%

Kim is in China now.  Either Putin or Moon is next.  That way when he meets with the Donald, if in fact he does, it won't matter how much Bolton froths at the mouth as Kim will have a stacked deck to offer Trump.  Sad but likely IMHO.
Factors that went into my *updated* (26 March) forecast:

Things that need to be happening for this to happen before November are in motion. The additional invitation and response by the Trump administration also removes US opposition to a meeting. Watching for the outcome of talks that happen this week to see if any complications show up.

Really seems to be happening. Hope they don’t argue about height of chairs etc (second link)
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/mar/24/north-and-south-korea-schedule-talks-at-panmunjom-within-days

No matter what John Bolton's mustache thinks about this, or what the Twit King says, both of these lads want to show that the US can't push them around.   Meeting will of course be in the North, because the Kims don't leave the country after they have become deities.
New "war" cabinet, regional tensions ie Taiwan. Global NATO, US and Coalition troop movements. Arms Deals. MBS world tour. Etc....

I'm trying to figure out how John Bolton as Trump's new national security advisor will affect this question. Bolton advocates NK regime change by force. Will this drive SK and NK closer together, or incite NK to call off its charm offensive? SK stands to lose the most from a resumption  of the Korean War, which still is under an armistice and could resume within minutes.  @shivadiva @Anneinak @cdob63 @Censusguyz @SneakyPete

Dateline 3-21-2018 South Korean President Moon Jae-in suggested that he and U.S. President Donald Trump could sit down for three-way talks with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un if their individual meetings go as anticipated.

The resumption of US-ROK exercises always triggers sharp rebukes from Pyongyang, but actual policy changes rarely ensue.  I think it unlikely the US Prez will actually end up meeting Li'l Kim; one or both will find excuses to postpone the event until it dies in a corner, unloved and largely unmourned.   Hard to say whether this decreases the odds of the ROK-DPRK schmoozefest since the political need for it will have diminished, or increases the odds because both leaders wish to show that they are independent of whatever the US says or does.  Therefore, cravenly staying at my previous number.

Work has begun - U.S. and North Korean reps will meet in Finland for "second-tier" talks on denuclearization, CNN reports this morning. Just don't ask for "the meeting's date, time, location or participants," because that info is not available yet, according to the host country's foreign ministry.
Where some of these whispers came from: The sighting of "a top North Korean official...apparently boarding a plane to Finland on Sunday," CNN reported.
That official: "Choe Kang Il, the deputy director general for North American affairs at North Korea's foreign ministry."
Oh, by the way: "Separately, Sweden is meeting with North Korean officials about three Americans [Kim Sang Duk, Kim Hak-Song, and Kim Dong Chul] held captive by the Asian nation."
Other diplomatic moves: South Korean President Moon Jae-in is considering "face-to-face talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping and Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe in the coming weeks to coordinate a strategy on North Korea," Seoul's Yonhap News agency reported Sunday.
Kim Jong-un will be negotiating from a position of strength and could use the opportunity to make concessions that will help N. Korea's economy
Talks continue, the outward appearance seems in every way to confirm a meeting will occur soon, before November.
Really surprised by the high percentage forecasts, when Moon hasn't accepted to meet. And they have to do it by Nov2018 to count.
So it seems Trumpy really does want to meet Un. So it only makes sense that Moon will do it too.
With thawing relations and the effects of the U.S. sanctions, Kim will want to get into negotiations.

With Trump pushing for a meeting as soon as possible, the follow up meeting with SK will be dependent on the tone of Trump's.  I see it very likely for the meeting to not go horribly despite Trump's typical haphazardness because he can on occasion be settled.  Outside view would suggest no meeting due to lack of contact in many years, but the current dynamics are too unique to be ignored.
Moon striking while the iron is hot + distraction from South Korean domestic political sexual harassment scandal (involving moon's party).
Holding at 65%. Without a Secretary, State Dept. may need time to draw up a draft Peace agreement.

Well knock me over with a feather. Now casino-bankrupter with inflated ego masquerading as leader of the free world is planning to meet Kim without preconditions, anything is possible! Though I'm leaning towards it just being yet another distracting PR stunt. I pity the USSS with the enormous task of protecting their principal. Such a tough job made even tougher. Maybe Chief of Staff (if still in the role) General John Kelly will order the Filet-O-Fish, Big Macs and choc milkshakes from South Korea. A Trump-Kim meeting question is needed, which I'd put at 45% by May 2018. [Bloomberg is reporting April, so then that'd be 90% perhaps].
Kim Jong Un Wants a Peace Treaty From Trump, Report Says
To me they appear to be more friendly than what they show to the world.
Because both leaders and countries gain by such a meeting.
Everything is moving in this direction. Given Trump's decision to meet Kim (whether it goes through or not), Kim's signals almost require Moon to meet with him.
Now that President Trump is talking  about setting the stage with the N.Korean leader the ball game just got very interesting. My Question Can Peace win out over the peninsula.
Kim Jong-Un is playing for time and the easing of sanctions.

China is pressuring NK to back off of the USA. NK & SK meeting is a huge softening of the NK position. China knows the Trump administration can cost them $ and will use that as leverage to have NK capitulate. The steel / aluminum tariffs were partially designed for this.

Drivers are: Trump's need to achieve a major victory in advance of key midterms; to attempt to prove news media wrong about him; to demonstrate that he is in fact an excellent president; to prove his negotiating skills; to defuse the threat from North Korea; and to establish his global standing with national leader around the world. Kim appears to see something special and compatible in Trump--a man he can deal with. Kim most likely doesn't want to live under the threat of a possible preemptive strike, and there could be considerable and broad internal pressure from his military. Kim also wants a seat at the international table. Offsetting this are the probable issues that will arise when the details are negotiated as both leaders posture, and as Kim considers the prospect and consequences of denuclearization.

Moon seems genuinely interested in talks and seems to have developed a clear line of communication and relationships between mid-level advisers, and are building a series of confidence building measures that makes me think this is a very real possibility. But will all things DPRK, my baseline is fairly low. If the US was opposed, I would put this at closer to 15%, but Trump's openness makes me think the US won't play the role of spoiler for potential talks.

I'm ready to slide back down the ladder at a moments notice but for now I am content to expect everyone take the win. NK gets  legitimacy and a face to face with a president, the President gets at a minimum the right to say "I tried" (before doing what ever he has planned), and for now SK is placated that all is being done to avoid war.

Odds go up on this if the Kim-Littlefingers meet actually happens and doesn't crash right away--this meeting would be a natural next step--or maybe even if it doesn't, depending on what Kim and Moon say about the cancellation/postponement/curtailment.  Niels Bohr, I think, is the one quoted as saying that predictions are difficult, especially about the future.  This has been increasingly true for a while now; stay tuned.

per NYT today the meeting is on and scheduled for April.

Once POTUS " accepted" meeting with Kim III very difficult to leverage ROK  to delay summit talks.
Momentum is building in ROK and Kim III met Moon specs by stating "denuclearization" and stating  no more missile wmd testing without  requirement that US and ROK suspend exercises.....Moon's short term goal has been met.
But the formula requires "irreversible" and "verifiable" removal of WMD capacity.
AS we have seen with the Iran JCPOA meeting this benchmark with removal of fissile materials does not address   "miniaturization"  (Warheads) and delivery systems (icbms) (Kissinger Schultz critique of JCPOA)
But it does allow Moon to make his flight to Pyongyang without risking any loss of face if a deal is not reached.
Moon can now blame DPRK and US for  the failure to engage in and complete talks.
Short term: Kim III has succeeded in  driving a wedge between ROK and US procedurally
as there will now be 2 tracks
Kim III -Moon on intra Korean issues ( family visits, Kaesong, reunification) 
and US-DPRK on denuclearization
Us must ensure that any ROK concessions  in Moon Summit
are expressly conditioned on  not just a suspension of testing
but a US-DPRK agreement on complete and verifiable denuclearization
yes as the story develops the likelyhood ist very big

Scaling from 69 to 97 given the third inter-Korean summit is planned to be held in the latter half of April, before which a direct hotline will be established between the two. Keeping it at 97 given DPRK's history of indicating to negotiate and pulling out of talks at the last minute (although these set of negotiations seem optimistic given the agreement to invite South Korean troupes to Pyongyang and the personal letter addressed to Kim Jong Eun signed by Pres. Moon AND an apparent agreement to normalize ties as expressed by Kim Yong Chul who has been responsible for the North's policies on the South - including aggression).

Odds are spiking on this one, I think.  They both have the same reason for doing this:  To show their respective domestic audiences that the US does not influence them.  This is not true, of course, but an inexpensive way of pretending it is would be a quick round of kissy-face accompanied by an exchange of heartfelt meaningless cliches.  Stay tuned.
Going to 100 for the next month or so (see link) then dropping back to zero because I still think this is a classic diplomatic strategy of North Korea.

I started off at 0% and even yesterday was optimistic at 70%. Now they are going to meet in DMZ. Kim Fatty III continues to surprise me. I still think this is for sanctions/food/$ relief (like his old man) but he has proven me wrong before...

The understanding reached with NK is being referred to as "March 5 Agreements" in SK. Opinions are divided on NK's sincerity but SK will hold a summit with KJU in late April at Peace House in JSA. This will be the 3rd inter-Korean summit, 1st in 11 years.

I have belatedly found the reports that they will meet next month. As others forecasters must have seen this story and changed their forecasts I looked online for reports yesterday and failed to find them, which either means my searches were badly constructed or the info was not very prominent.
Post-Olympics Détente and a push from Putin and a nudge from China

NK is showing interest in improving relations with SK. Presumably NK wants something; could be the sanctions are biting; could be they have run into technical problems with the ICBM program (so can't do any test for a while); could be both. Unlikely that SK or US will trust them. But it is possible that SK will think they have nothing to lose pretending they think NK is sincere, as long as they don't give anything to NK. So could go as far as agreeing to Moon Jae-in meeting Kim Jong-un. I would suspect they would want "officials" to hold meetings and get to some concrete negotiating position first, or at least clarification of what Kim has in mind. If sanctions are having an affect the longer SK can delay a meeting the better. If its technical issues with ICBM test then NK is likely to be trying to spin it out before a meeting so they can quickly do more tests when the talks break down (which they almost certainly will. My money would be on difficulties with the ICBM program.

To date Kim Fatty III has avoided foreign officials - including the Chinese who used to be ardent supporters (now mostly passive supporters afraid of regime collapse and economic refugees or US troops at their border). Now he’s ramping up the diplomacy? Note: his father was master of taking things to brink and then discussing (and getting) financial support. At minimum, suspect this (angling for easing of sanctions etc.) and possibly more. Regardless, for purposes of this question I’m staying heavy on chances Moon and Fatty will meet. Moon is somewhat an appeaser and Fatty needs the Benjamins.

I'm am dropping my estimate -20%. The reason not higher is the pressure applied by the US and the possibility 1) War will break out in the meantime (2%) 2) A state visit cannot be planned by Nov 1 (5%) 3) An act will occur in the meantime that will offend NK and revoke the invite (12%) 4) Either leader dies of natural or unnatural causes (3%) 5) Political action may not include state head visits -20%

Objections by the other names on the dance card US and japan Russia and China have the potential to delay the event past the questions horizon. This may or may not occur.  This will depend on nK's reaction to US-South Korea joint exercises and whether nK causes another provocation.  It will also require time to coordinate such a meeting which is not currently in the works formally.

Based recent moon statements and possible positive outcome of Olympic interactions.

It would be very difficult for trump to escalate a diplomatic meeting between the two leaders to any sort of hostile action, yet it would be what Kim Jong-un might do to irritate trump knowing he doesn't want the meeting.

Going up a bit but the domestic and international pressure on Moon keep this from being too likely without more preliminary work. Until I see goodwill gestures from North Korea or lower level meetings I won't think this is going to happen.

After the 2018 Winter Olympics, the chances of South Korean President Moon Jae-in meeting iwth North Korean leader Kim Jong-un are much higher than they have ever been. South Korea and North Korea competing in the games under one unified team has created a great deal of optimism throughout the international community. President Moon is hoping to continue peaceful dialogues with North Korea, however, I cannot say that the probability is higher than 45% because South Korea is also facing a great deal of pressure from the United States to deal with North Korea in a more aggressive manner. https://www.cnn.com/2018/02/08/asia/north-korea-moon-jae-in-visit-possible/index.html

It is possible, this may occur but it would likely be the result of an impending crisis.

Maybe it’s the “Olympic lights” that might ignite such interaction, but chances of Kim Jong-un and Moon Jae-In meeting before the 1 November 2018 are higher than ever before. It is no question that the Olympics and the participation of both countries athletes competing together have ignited an optimistic and hopeful attitude between both countries negotiating teams. The only reason why I am not able to mark the chances any higher is the fact that South Korea, Moon Jae-In, would be in the most unfortunate position should they go about this meeting without finding a way to make the United States happy and content. It is no secret the US delegation would want as little interaction as possible without their involvement so I do not foresee this interaction happening anytime within the next month, but perhaps in the later summer.

My guesstimate is based on good reasoning provided with some recent estimates and updates, and recent Economist report of Mr Moon's intent to see continued detante first.
There is publicly-expressed desire by both leaders to unite. NKs military focus, and US geopolitics and base in SK are wild cards which may reduce the probability of a meeting any time soon.
Moon will go North almost assuredly. Will he meet Kim Fatty III? Unlikely. Will be looking for concessions before that happens.
They will have to do it fairly quickly in order to build on the rapport developed during the Olympics for the meeting to remain relevant in current world affairs.
The more north continues to flex its military muscle the less likely that there will be a meet and greet.
Unless North Koreans immediately test something after olympics this meeting should take place
Based on discussions at Olympics, more likely.
Big turn of events post Olympics. Could result in US being left out of any initial meetings but why not? They are neighbors.
Increased chance after the smooching session during the Olympics.

He may break her stuff and loister her away under a mountain somewhere OR put her out as the new spokesman for NK but I don't see that happening.
MY POINT - a meeting would give the stage back to dear leader and take the spot light off his Sister.

Bumping up again. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/09/world/asia/kim-yo-jong-history-facts.html
I know I diverge from majority consensus on this topic but at this point I will take the approach as to what would keep the two leaders from meeting. I see 2 things.
1. USA. Trump actually make this both easier and dicier. The stance against NK along with the crazy talks of war coming from the Trump administration put Moon into a situation where SK is at the highest risk if war comes but he is also at risk of breaking with the strongest ally of SK if he tries to prevent it via dialogue. Not a great position to be in. 
2. Internal political groups that fear NK and Un. These groups are arguably the nearer influencers given Moon’s short term needs (being a politician). I think the games and yo Jong have done a good job so far building credibility for dialogue amount the public in general but there will always be detractors.

Clearly SK will face conflicting pressures over the invitation. Having Ms Kim in SK will increase the pressure for Moon Jae-in to go to meet Kim Jong-un. No invite for Trump will probably annoy Trump, but maybe Pence can get an invite as well. The problem for all concerned is that any solution to the NK problem needs talks, if the US refuses to agree that it is not unreasonable to start with a visit to NK by Moon Jae-in then the US looks like as if it standing in the way of a solution.  Presumably Trump would want KIm to make a gesture (in order for Trump to save face) which Kim will not do (in order for Kim to save face). So I would say its not a done deal. It would seem to require some high quality diplomacy to move forward. I am not sure that Trump can be controlled enough to carry it off.

Kim Jong Un invites South Korean president for summit: South Korea
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-olympics-2018-northkorea-southkorea/kim-jong-un-invites-south-korean-president-for-summit-south-korea-idUSKBN1FU05F

President Moon of South Korea was elected presenting a policy of open-mindedness and increased diplomacy regarding the North Korean regime. Moon has encouraged a meeting between him and Kim of the DPRK for some time now, and I believe they have a high chance of meeting between now and November due to yesterday's developments where Moon was invited by Kim's sister to visit the DPRK in the near future. According to reports coming out of the Blue House, Moon has "practically accepted the invitation." I believe it is only a matter of time before the two leaders meet to discuss a resolution to their decades-long conflict. However, the only thing that could stop their meeting from happening would be concerns expressed by the US which has flip-flopped on a lot of its issues regarding diplomatic interactions with the DPRK. As of now, it appears as if the US would not like the DPRK to engage diplomatically with South Korea unless it agreed to end or cut back on its nuclear program. I don't believe, however, that the US will stand in the way of these two nations meeting.

Moon has indicated that he would be willing to meet Kim, and Pyongyang and Seoul's recent moves to resume negotiations and form a unified team for the Winter Olympics seems to signal the possibility of a detente. However, the fact that Kim has never met a foreign leader since assuming power in 2011, the broader regional and international environment, particularly the hard-line position the US government takes on North Korea, and the badly damaged North-South relationship following two conservative presidencies in South Korea make a summit between Kim and Moon in the immediate future very unlikely.

ROK Presidents have twice met with DPRK leaders, both times in Pyongyang. Importantly, Moon was the private secretary to the second, Roh Moo-hyun, who met with Kim Jong-il in 2007 (the first, more famously, was Kim Dae-jung, who coined the phrase "Sunshine Policy"). During the campaign that resulted in Moon's election, he stated that his first foreign visit would be to North Korea. That obviously didn't turn out to be the case but with the mini-thaw that is happening now and Moon's stated willingness it seems (somewhat) likely.

I will revise my prediction downward to a pretty fair 18% chance of a meeting between these two leaders. Moon Jae-in is motivated to meet and talk because of his ideological approach. He wants to diplomatically resolve problems with the North. He has indicated he wants to meet. Kim may be inclined to meet if he continues to feel pressured. While he will never give up his arsenal or weapons development program, he may try to get some sanctions relief and buy himself some time via negotiations. Kim would be willing to meet for the same reasons he was willing to send a delegation to meet with the South on Tuesday---he is feeling the economic, political and military pressure. He wants relief and he wants to maneuver politically. If he calculates that the risks involved in a meeting are low and that he could even just possibly achieve a step toward his end goals via such a meeting, he may be inclined to do so.

On Tuesday, Moon Jae-in and Kim Jong-Un sent delegations to the DMZ's Punmanjom to hold a discussion concerning the North's participation in the Peongchang Winter Olympics. While no dialogue on the North's nuclear weapons development program took place, there is here, perhaps, the smallest thawing of tensions between sides, and the potential for strengthened diplomacy between them.  North Korea will be sending athletes to compete in the Winter Olympics.  The North just reopened an emergency military communications line with the South after nearly two years of silence. Moon Jae-In has said he is open to meeting with Kim.
